column1: Group Category Code Description
AC Directives AC "Answer calls; show attentiveness to communications."
CL Directives CL "Call attention to hearer by name or by substitute exclamations"
DR Directives DR "Dare or challenge hearer to perform an action."
RPCS Directives RPCS "Request propose or suggest an action for hearer or for hearer and speaker.
WS Statements WS "Express a wish."
SS Directives SS "Signal to start performing an act such as running or rolling a ball"
WD Directives WD "Warn of danger."
CXSC "Speech Elicitations" CXSC "Complete text if so demanded.
column2: Complete statement or other utterance in compliance with request"

column1: EAEIECEX "Speech Elicitations" EAEIECEX "Elicit onomatopoeic or animal sounds.
column2: Elicit imitation of word or sentence by modelling or by explicit command
column3: Elicit completion of word or sentence.

column1: RT "Speech Elicitations" RT "Repeat or imitate other's utterance."
PA Commitments PA "Permit hearer to perform act."
PF Commitments PF "Prohibit/forbid/protest hearer's performance of an act"
SI Commitments SI "State intent to carry out act by speaker."
PD Commitments PD "Promise."
TD Commitments TD "Threaten to do."
MKTOXA Markings MKTOXA "Mark occurrence of event (thank greet apologize congratulate etc.).
column2: Mark transfer of object to hearer

column1: CMEMED Markings CM "Commiserate express sympathy for hearer's distress.
EN Markings EN "Express positive emotion."
ES Markings ES "Express surprise."
STAPDWTXCT Statements STAPDWTXCT "Make a declarative statement.
column2: Agree with proposition or proposal expressed by previous speaker
column3: Disagree with proposition expressed by previous speaker.
column4: Read or recite written text aloud.
column5: Correct provide correct verbal form in place of erroneous one."

column1: GR Directives GR "Give reason; justify a request for an action refusal or prohibition"
DC Declarations DC "Create a new state of affairs by declaration"
DP Declarations DP "Declare make-believe reality."
AQ Questions AQ "Aggravated question expression of disapproval by restating a question"
AA Questions AA "Answer in the affirmative to yes/no question."
YD Declarations YD "Agree to a declaration."
ADALGI Directives ADALGI "Agree to carry out an act requested or proposed by other.
column2: Agree to do something for the last time.
column3: Give in; accept other's insistence or refusal."

column1: AN Questions AN "Answer in the negative to yes/no question"
ND Declarations ND "Disagree with a declaration."
RD Directives RD "Refuse to carry out an act requested or proposed by other."
EQ Questions EQ "Eliciting question (e.g. hmm?)."
NA Questions NA "Intentionally nonsatisfying answer to question"
QN Questions QN "Ask a product-question (wh-question)"
RR "Demands for clarification" RR "Request to repeat utterance."
RA Questions RA "Refuse to answer."
SA Questions SA "Answer a wh-question with a statement."
TA Questions TA "Answer a limited-alternative question."
QA Questions QA "Answer a question with a wh-question."
YA Questions YA "Answer a question with a yes/no question."
YQTQ Questions YQTQ "Ask a yes/no question.
RQ Directives RQ "Yes/no question or suggestion about hearer's wishes and intentions"
FP Commitments FP "Ask for permission to carry out act."
PRCN Performances PRCN "Perform verbal move in game.
ABPMET Evalutions ABPMET "Approve of appropriate behavior.
column2: Praise for motor acts i.e for nonverbal behavior.

column1: CRDS Evalutions CR "Criticize or point out error in nonverbal act.
YYOO Vocalizations YY "Make a word-like utterance without clear function.
